intro: Prenanthes blinii, commonly known as the Blinii water dropwort, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as streambanks and wetlands. Its botanical features make it an important component of riparian ecosystems.
